issue.title: font-size: 0px on container elements
issue.body:
I couldn't find an answer to this in past issues, so apologies if this has been answered.

I've noticed when testing that the `font-size: 0px` on container elements like `<mjml-column>` causes text display issues in some email clients. There does not appear to be a way to set a default font size either like you can with `<mjml-table>`.

After some experimenting I've found a way around this, but was curious what others have experienced and possible solutions.

Cheers

![926df520-cd9b-42c3-a6f9-9eae282f3fdd](https://github.com/mjmlio/mjml/assets/976171/c5aee8d2-8723-4502-b790-07a97b26064f)

comment.body:
Sure, the code for the previous screenshot is included below.

When I was developing with the MJML desktop app, it warns me that the syntax is MJML 3. We are currently in the process of upgrading all our templates to MJML 4, but I don't believe the update will resolve this particular issue out of the box. I could be wrong though, hence why I thought I'd ask the question.

```
<mj-section mj-class="pt-12 pb-8">
    <mj-column>
        <mj-text mj-class="text-xl font-bold">Congratulations @if(!empty($user->first_name)) {{ $user->first_name }}, @else Member, @endif</mj-text>
        <mj-text mj-class="text-gray-500 py-4">Start earning {{ $provider->name }} Rewards Points every time you pay your Symbion statements and other bills.</mj-text>
        <mj-button mj-class="bg-symbion-500 font-bold pb-6" align="left" href="{{$$url}}" inner-padding="12px 24px">Login</mj-button>
    </mj-column>
</mj-section>
<mj-wrapper mj-class="bg-neutral-50">
    <mj-section>
        <mj-column>
            <mj-text mj-class="text-2xl font-bold pt-6">Let’s get you started in 3 easy steps!</mj-text>
            <mj-text mj-class="text-gray-500 pt-1 pb-0">Login and complete the steps below:</mj-text>
        </mj-column>
    </mj-section>
    <mj-section mj-class="py-1">
        <mj-column width="12%" mj-class="pt-1">
            <mj-button mj-class="bg-symbion-500 font-bold rounded-full" align="center" inner-padding="12px 20px">1</mj-button>
        </mj-column>
        <mj-column width="88%">
            <mj-text mj-class="text-xl font-bold pb-0">Choose how many points you want to earn</mj-text>
            <mj-text mj-class="text-gray-500 pt-0">Select from either the Platinum, Gold or Executive Points Program</mj-text>
        </mj-column>
    </mj-section>
    <mj-section mj-class="py-1">
        <mj-column width="12%" mj-class="pt-1">
            <mj-button mj-class="bg-symbion-500 font-bold rounded-full" align="center" inner-padding="12px 20px">2</mj-button>
        </mj-column>
        <mj-column width="88%">
            <mj-text mj-class="text-xl font-bold pb-0">Add your Symbion accounts</mj-text>
            <mj-text mj-class="text-gray-500 pt-0">Access and pay all of your Symbion accounts</mj-text>
        </mj-column>
    </mj-section>
    <mj-section mj-class="py-1">
        <mj-column width="12%" mj-class="pt-4">
            <mj-button mj-class="bg-symbion-500 font-bold rounded-full" align="center" inner-padding="12px 20px">3</mj-button>
        </mj-column>
        <mj-column width="88%">
            <mj-text mj-class="text-xl font-bold pb-0">Cancel any existing Direct Debits with Symbion</mj-text>
            <mj-text mj-class="text-gray-500 pt-0">Contact your Symbion Account Manager or call 1300 772 000 to cancel your existing Symbion Direct Debit to avoid double payment</mj-text>
        </mj-column>
    </mj-section>
    <mj-section mj-class="pt-12">
        <mj-column>
            <mj-text mj-class="text-sm text-center text-gray-700">Accepted Payment Methods</mj-text>
        </mj-column>
    </mj-section>
</mj-wrapper>
```

issue.title: font-size: 0px on container elements
issue.body:
I couldn't find an answer to this in past issues, so apologies if this has been answered.

I've noticed when testing that the `font-size: 0px` on container elements like `<mjml-column>` causes text display issues in some email clients. There does not appear to be a way to set a default font size either like you can with `<mjml-table>`.

After some experimenting I've found a way around this, but was curious what others have experienced and possible solutions.

Cheers

![926df520-cd9b-42c3-a6f9-9eae282f3fdd](https://github.com/mjmlio/mjml/assets/976171/c5aee8d2-8723-4502-b790-07a97b26064f)

comment.body:
Hi, Can you share some code to reproduce ?On 24 Oct 2023, at 05:40, Ravi Sundram ***@***.***> wrote:﻿
I couldn't find an answer to this in past issues, so apologies if this has been answered.
I've noticed when testing that the font-size: 0px on container elements like <mjml-column> causes text display issues in some email clients. There does not appear to be a way to set a default font size either like you can with <mjml-table>.
After some experimenting I've found a way around this, but was curious what others have experienced and possible solutions.
Cheers

issue.title: font-size: 0px on container elements
issue.body:
I couldn't find an answer to this in past issues, so apologies if this has been answered.

I've noticed when testing that the `font-size: 0px` on container elements like `<mjml-column>` causes text display issues in some email clients. There does not appear to be a way to set a default font size either like you can with `<mjml-table>`.

After some experimenting I've found a way around this, but was curious what others have experienced and possible solutions.

Cheers

![926df520-cd9b-42c3-a6f9-9eae282f3fdd](https://github.com/mjmlio/mjml/assets/976171/c5aee8d2-8723-4502-b790-07a97b26064f)

issue.title: mj-body doesn't support width='100%' for ms outlook
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
it is not working for ms outlook, but works fine for others when I want to give 100% width to mj-section over mj-body.

**To Reproduce**
example case: 
`
<mjml>
  <mj-body width="600px" background-color="#ffffff">
    <mj-body width="100%">
      <mj-section>
        <mj-column>
          <mj-text>hello world!</mj-text>
        </mj-column>
      </mj-section>
    </mj-body>
  </mj-body>
</mjml>
`

**output as an html**
`
...
  <body>
    <div style="background-color: #fff">
      <div>
        <!--[if mso | IE]><table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="" 
            style="width:100%;" width="100" >
              <tr>
                  <td style="line-height:0px;font-size:0px;mso-line-height-rule:exactly;"><![endif]-->
        <div style="margin: 0 auto; max-width: 100%">
          <table
            align="center"
            border="0"
            cellpadding="0"
            cellspacing="0"
            role="presentation"
            style="width: 100%"
          >
...
...
`


**Expected behavior**

As you see on the HTML output, if mso, it generates a code like : style="width:100%;" **width="100"** 

In here, for outlook, it breaks the styling. When I look at the mjml-section source code, the code is as follows: 

**Source**: https://github.com/mjmlio/mjml/blob/a7847de40c42b587eab21956dfbbe455fcfbf440/packages/mjml-section/src/index.js#L196C1-L210C8


`
...
...
    return `
      <!--[if mso | IE]>
      <table
        ${this.htmlAttributes({
          align: 'center',
          border: '0',
          cellpadding: '0',
          cellspacing: '0',
          class: suffixCssClasses(this.getAttribute('css-class'), 'outlook'),
          role: 'presentation',
          style: { width: `${containerWidth}` },
          width: parseInt(containerWidth, 10),
          ...bgcolorAttr,
        })}
      >
...
`

as seen above, line number 207 breaks the styling. I think that, it needs to be fixed, otherwise, when you create a new mjml component which is extended from mj-body will have a styling problem on MS Outlook as we live right now. 


**Screenshots**

![Screenshot 2023-10-23 at 13 47 07](https://github.com/mjmlio/mjml/assets/747677/bb2003a1-f638-4166-ad65-ba174860628e)
![Screenshot 2023-10-23 at 13 47 57](https://github.com/mjmlio/mjml/assets/747677/16096e77-9a42-4552-a1af-e6430cfada92)

from the source: 
![Screenshot 2023-10-23 at 13 49 32](https://github.com/mjmlio/mjml/assets/747677/23030ec0-2a07-43de-b87b-b916286bd5cc)


**Additional context**

Add any other context about the problem here.

...

In here, for outlook, it breaks the styling. When I look at the mjml-section source code, the code is as follows:

![Screenshot 2023-10-23 at 13 47 07](https://github.com/mjmlio/mjml/assets/747677/bb2003a1-f638-4166-ad65-ba174860628e)
![Screenshot 2023-10-23 at 13 47 57](https://github.com/mjmlio/mjml/assets/747677/16096e77-9a42-4552-a1af-e6430cfada92)

from the source: 
![Screenshot 2023-10-23 at 13 49 32](https://github.com/mjmlio/mjml/assets/747677/23030ec0-2a07-43de-b87b-b916286bd5cc)


**Additional context**

Add any other context about the problem here.

comment.body:
Width need to be defined in `px` because outlook ghost table can't be defined in percent.
![Screenshot 2023-10-23 at 15 36 08](https://github.com/mjmlio/mjml/assets/570317/d54e3286-02f5-43ae-9ea2-23d3ee9d7080)
